00034 class MCGeometry {

00097     typedef std::map< QuadricAndSense, CellVec >  SCConnectMap;

00103     CellMap    _cells;

00111 
00112     /* NOTE: using a pair as a key value should be legit, because when a pair
00113      * searches by testing for "less than" or "greater than" it tests the first
00114      * member, then the second; so for all comparisons except for the surface
00115      * sense it tests only a memory reference (integer) and on the last
00116      * comparison it tests for the boolean sense. SO MAKE SURE QUADRIC AND
00117      * SENSE HAS QUADRIC DEFINED AS THE FIRST PART OF THE PAIR.
00118      */
00119 
00120     //typedef std::pair< std::vector<Cell*>, std::vector<Cell*> > PmCellVec;

00128 
00129 
00131     //  when this reaches zero, connectivity is complete
00132     //  unmatched surfaces are from cell's point of view, i.e. surfaces may be
00133     //  and probably will be double-counted

00138 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00139 inline void MCGeometry::intersect(
00140                             const std::vector<double>& position,
00141                             const std::vector<double>& direction,
00142                             const unsigned int oldCellId,
00143                             std::vector<double>& newPosition,
00144                             unsigned int& newCellId,
00145                             double& distanceTraveled,
00146                             ReturnStatus& returnStatus)
00147 {
00148 //    cout << "unmatched surface count: " << _unMatchedSurfaces << endl;
00149 
00150     Require(position.size() == 3);
00151     Require(direction.size() == 3);
00152     Require(softEquiv(tranSupport::vectorNorm(direction), 1.0));
00153 
00154     CellMap::iterator findResult = _cells.find(oldCellId);
00155     Require(findResult != _cells.end());
00156 
00157     // a reference to the pointer to the old cell
00158     Cell& oldCell = *(findResult->second);
00159 
00160     // call intersect on the old cell to find the surface and distance that it
00161     // moves to
00162     Quadric* hitQuadric;
00163     bool     oldQuadricSense;
00164     oldCell.intersect(position, direction, hitQuadric, oldQuadricSense,
00165                       distanceTraveled);
00166 
00167     Check(hitQuadric != NULL);
00168     Check(distanceTraveled >= 0.0);
00169 
00170     returnStatus = MCG_NORMAL;
00171 
00172     // ===== calculate transported position on the boundary of our new cell
00173     newPosition.resize(3);
00174     for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
00175         newPosition[i] = position[i] + distanceTraveled * direction[i];
00176     }
00177 
00178 
00179     // ===== Loop over neighborhood cells
00180     Cell::CellVec& neighborhood = oldCell.getNeighbors(hitQuadric);
00181 
00182     // loop through the old cell's hood to find if it's in one of those cells
00183     for (Cell::CellVec::const_iterator it  = neighborhood.begin();
00184                                        it != neighborhood.end(); ++it)
00185     {
00186         // check if the point is inside (and pass hitQuadric to exclude
00187         // checking it)
00188         if ( (*it)->isPointInside( newPosition, hitQuadric ) )
00189         {
00190             //we have found the new cell
00191             newCellId = (*it)->getUserId();
00192 
00193 //            cout << "Found ending cell " << newCellId
00194 //                 << " already connected to starting cell "
00195 //                 << oldCellId << " through hood" << endl;
00196 
00197             return;
00198         }
00199     }
00200 
00201     // ===== Loop through all cells that have the same surface as the one we
00202     // intersected, and the opposite surface sense (i.e. if in our cell we hit
00203     // surface 2, and our cell is defined as being -2, then the cell on the
00204     // other side has to have orientation +2
00205 
00206     QuadricAndSense searchQas(hitQuadric, !oldQuadricSense);
00207 
00208     SCConnectMap::iterator cellList
00209                  = _surfToCellConnectivity.find(searchQas);
00210     Check(cellList != _surfToCellConnectivity.end());
00211 
00212     CellVec& cellsToCheck = cellList->second;
00213 
00214     for (Cell::CellVec::iterator pNewCell  = cellsToCheck.begin();
00215                                  pNewCell != cellsToCheck.end(); ++pNewCell)
00216     {
00217         // check if the point is inside (and pass hitQuadric to exclude
00218         // checking it)
00219         if ( (*pNewCell)->isPointInside( newPosition, hitQuadric ) )
00220         {
00221             // if this is the first cell linked to this surface, we decrement 
00222             // the unmatched surfaces
00223             if (neighborhood.size() == 0)
00224                 _unMatchedSurfaces--;
00225 
00226             // add new cell to old cell's hood connectivity
00227             neighborhood.push_back(*pNewCell);
00228 
00229             Cell::CellVec& newNeighborhood
00230                 = (*pNewCell)->getNeighbors(hitQuadric);
00231 
00232             // if this is the first cell linked to this surface, we decrement 
00233             // the unmatched surfaces
00234             if (newNeighborhood.size() == 0)
00235                 _unMatchedSurfaces--;
00236 
00237             // add old cell to new cell's hood connectivity
00238             newNeighborhood.push_back(&oldCell);
00239 
00240             // we have found the new cell
00241             newCellId = (*pNewCell)->getUserId();
00242 
00243 //            cout << "Connected ending cell " << newCellId
00244 //                 << " to starting cell " << oldCellId << endl;
00245 //            if (_unMatchedSurfaces == 0)
00246 //                cout << "CONNECTIVITY COMPLETE." << endl;
00247             return;
00248         }
00249     }
00250 
00251     // TODO: when looping through the other cells in the problem, exclude the
00252     // ones that we already checked in the cell's hood; means more loops but
00253     // fewer flops in the "is inside" method calls
00254 
00255     newCellId = 0;
00256     returnStatus = MCG_LOST;
00257     Insist(0, "Ruh-roh, new cell not found!");
00258 }
00259 /*----------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
00260 inline unsigned int MCGeometry::findCell(
00261                                 const std::vector<double>& position) const
00262 {
00263     // loop through all cells in problem
00264     CellMap::const_iterator itCel = _cells.begin();
00265     
00266     while (itCel != _cells.end()) {
00267         if (itCel->second->isPointInside(position))  {
00268             return itCel->first;
00269         }
00270 
00271         ++itCel;
00272     }
00273 
00274     // cell not found!
00275     return 0;
00276 }
